definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: You are cordially invited to a reception to be given in our ministry on Saturday evening.
sentences.chinese: 誠懇邀請參加我部本星期六晚間舉行的招待會。

sentences.english: She managed to wangle an invitation to the reception.
sentences.chinese: 她設法弄到了招待會的請帖。

sentences.english: The press conference ended up in a slanging match , each side shouting at the other.
sentences.chinese: 記者招待會最後變成謾罵比賽，雙方相對咆哮。

sentences.english: Mr. Marce will host a reception tonight.
sentences.chinese: 馬斯先生將主持今晚的招待會。

sentences.english: They will call a press conference as soon as the results are known.
sentences.chinese: 結果一見分曉，他們將立即舉行記者招待會。

sentences.english: On March 25, Foreign Ministry Spokesman Kong Quan held the regular press conference.
sentences.chinese: 3月25日，外交部發言人孔泉主持例行記者招待會。
許多著名人士參加了招待會。

sentences.english: The reception was followed by a modern dance performance by the Guangdong Modern Dance Company.
sentences.chinese: 招待會完後，我們欣賞了廣東現代舞團的精彩表演。

sentences.english: Representatives of Chinese-American groups that appeared at the news conference supported the resolution.
sentences.chinese: 記者招待會上，華裔代表們對此決議表示強烈支持。

sentences.english: Luo Fuhe, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC), attended the reception.
sentences.chinese: 全國政協副主席羅富和出席了此次招待會。

sentences.english: Have you noticed simultaneous translation at the press conference?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到了記者招待會上的同聲翻譯嗎？

sentences.english: Most of the people invited to the reception were old friends.
sentences.chinese: 應邀出席招待會的人大多數是老朋友。

sentences.english: A formal gown befits the diplomatic reception.
sentences.chinese: 一套禮服適合外事招待會。

sentences.english: If, however, you were holding an opening air garden party or fete.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要舉辦露天遊園會或者招待會。

sentences.english: She appeared at the reception with splendid jewels.
sentences.chinese: 她一身珠光寶氣出現在招待會上。

sentences.english: In the press conference, the general gave a rationalization for the retreat of his army.
sentences.chinese: 在記者招待會上，將軍解釋了他的軍隊爲何撤退。

definition: to deliver (a diploma, licence etc)/to qualify
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
to swear the oath of office
Chen Chien-jen (1951-), Taiwanese politician, vice president of the Republic of China 2016-2020
